alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 5:24PM EST until January 12 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN MARION AND SOUTHEASTERN CHATTAHOOCHEE COUNTIES... At 524 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Juniper to near Christopher to Jamestown/south Fort Benning, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cusseta, Brantley, Christopher, Marion Estates, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Oakland, Manta and Zellobee. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for west central Georgia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
